intro: Eremopanax angustatus f. angusticarpus, commonly known as the narrow-fruit eremopanax, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the Araliaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, compound leaves and distinctive, elongated fruits. The plant is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features include small, clustered flowers and a unique morphology that sets it apart from other members of its genus. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
